1.title: I'm Not a Child, I'm 20
1.plot: Michelle Kish is 20 years old, but is regularly mistaken for a child. The reason? She suffers from an extremely rare genetic disorder called Hallermann-Streiff Syndrome which affects just one in five million people. Michelle's symptoms include a cranial-facial disorder, cataracts, and dwarfism. She talks about her frustrations, as well as her career plans and what character traits she'd like in a boyfriend.

2.title: The Girl Who's Allergic To Everything
2.plot: "British Championship disability gymnast, Natasha Coates, 22, is allergic to everything. She has won 19 British titles and placed first in the British Disability Championships.After years of suffering from continuous allergic reactions, 22 year old Natasha was finally diagnosed with Mast Cell Activation Syndrome.Despite her daily battles with her allergies, this has not stopped Natasha from pursuing her passion for gymnastics."

3.title: I'm Proud of My Albinism
3.plot: "Leo is 22 and has albinism, a condition which affects the body's production of the pigment that gives skin, hair and eyes their colour.Born to black parents, Leo's brother and sister also have albinism. Although he struggled to accept the condition as a child, Leo grew to be proud of his unique looks and has become a model. Leo's high profile career is a source of inspiration to other young people with the condition."

4.title: My Singing Stops My Tourette's
4.plot: Emilly Carter, 20, has had Tourette's for as long as she can remember. Tics include mimicking voices, shrugging her head and touching her nose. But when Emilly sings, her tics vanish.

5.title: I Feel Beautiful, Even with My Feeding Tube
5.plot: "Emily Jones is 22, and is currently living with a feeding tube. Growing up, she suffered from chronic joint pain, and at age 15 was diagnosed with Ehlers Danlos syndrome (EDS) type 3, a connective tissue disease affecting her joints, muscles, skin and organs.Doctors gave Emily a feeding tube because she couldn't keep food or liquids down. It's been a huge challenge, but hasn't stopped Emily pursuing her passion for beauty blogging and make-up tutorials."

6.title: Our Insta Star Cerebral Palsy Daughter
6.plot: Five year-old Finley was born with cerebral palsy. Mum Christina raises awareness of the condition with a blog and Instagram account of her and Finley wearing matching outfits.

1.title: Our Baby Made of Glass
1.plot: Meet Zoe, six, who has brittle bone disease and suffers painful bone fractures very easily. But overcoming these challenges is only making her stronger.

2.title: Our Down's Syndrome Twins
2.plot: Matt and Jodi's twin girls Abigail and Isobel were diagnosed with Down's Syndrome at birth.The NHS will soon offer a prenatal test for women which offers 99% accuracy of detection.

3.title: I Am a Limbless Weightlifter
3.plot: 31 year old Lindsay was born without arms or legs, but, despite this, became an accomplished swimmer and skier, played rugby, and now takes part in competitive weightlifting.

4.title: The Woman With Two Vaginas
4.plot: Nikki was born with two vaginas.Her life has been affected by prolonged periods as well as numerous miscarriages, so she opted to have a hysterectomy.

5.title: Autistic Twins & Us
5.plot: Mark and Annie's twin boys Jacob and Samuel have severe Autism, but involvement in the Son Rise Program has allowed them to communicate as a family.

6.title: The Double Amputee Skateboarder
6.plot: When he was eleven Italo lost both legs after getting trapped underneath a train while train surfing. Despite this, he's now a professional skateboarder.

1.title: Our Teen Who Dies If He Falls Asleep
1.plot: 17 year-old Liam suffers from a rare condition that means if he falls asleep, he dies.Doctors gave Liam just six weeks to live after birth, but later this year he is turning 18.

2.title: My Dad the Powerlifting Champion
2.plot: Rich Willis, 47, born with diastrophic dwarfism, has a serious passion for powerlifting.After over fifty surgeries, he's hoping to qualify and compete in the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

3.title: I Am A Paralysed Beauty Blogger
3.plot: Tess Daly is completely paralyzed but has gained tens of thousands of followers online because of the amazing make up she can apply with the limited movement in her hand.

4.title: Our Fragile Superhero Son
4.plot: Kaden Casebolt, 5, has Osteogenesis Imperfecta, meaning his bones can break from sneezing.Despite his fragility, the superhero-obsessed boy loves dressing up as his heroes.

5.title: Our Girl With the Mystery Condition
5.plot: "The nine-year old with a condition so rare it doesn't have a name.Katie has Megalencephaly - a growth development disorder. However she also has other unexplained symptoms including fatty tissue that's gathered around her face.

6.title: The Woman Who's Constantly Sexually Aroused
6.plot: Amanda McLaughlin has a rare disorder that means she constantly feels sexually aroused. But now, with the help of Professors at Michigan University, she's being offered some hope.

imdb.title: Living Differently
plot: A series of short films profiling inspirational people who have conditions that causes them to live their lives differently.
